intro: Atropis elata, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in cyathia, a type of specialized inflorescence. It typically grows in dry, open habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. The latex it produces is toxic and can cause skin irritation, which is a common feature among members of its family.
